intro: Potentilla permollis, commonly known as the softleaf cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a soft, velvety texture, which distinguishes it from other species in the genus. Potentilla permollis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can be found in alpine gardens and rockeries.
